column1: Motivation for this project comes from the necessity
to accurately represent spectral surface reflectance in the retrieval
of aerosol from space.  Over land, up to 70% of the measured signal
can come from reflection from the surface. Poor knowledge of surface
reflection is one of the largest contributions to the uncertainty in
aerosol loading and particle size with commensurate uncertainty in
estimates of local air quality.  The studentship involves the
construction of a four channel radiometer with channels located at
those on AATSR).  The instrument will scan in both zenith and azimuth
to characterize the scene BRDF.  The major technical goal of the
project will be to demonstrate that a miniature instrument based upon
recently developed filters and detectors can achieve performance
comparable to that of current space based instrumentation with the
long term aim of performing these measurements from small satellites.
